intro: Impatiens siamensis, commonly known as the Siam impatiens, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its showy, brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Impatiens siamensis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
